concise_definition: n. 牛棚, 备用投手区, 待命区

definitions.explanation_en: In baseball, the area where relief pitchers warm up before entering the game, typically located beyond the outfield fence or along the foul lines.
definitions.explanation_cn: 在棒球运动中，指替补投手在上场前热身的区域，通常位于外野围栏之外或沿界线附近。
definitions.example_en: The manager sent the rookie to the bullpen to get loose before his first appearance.
definitions.example_cn: 教练让这位新秀去牛棚热身，为他的首次登场做准备。

definitions.explanation_en: A group of relief pitchers on a baseball team who are available to enter the game and replace the starting pitcher.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指一支棒球队中所有替补投手的集合，他们随时准备上场替换先发投手。
definitions.example_en: The team's bullpen has been the strongest part of their roster this season.
definitions.example_cn: 本赛季，球队的牛棚是阵容中最强大的部分。

definitions.explanation_en: In a broader sense, any area or group designated for waiting, preparation, or temporary holding, especially in non-sports contexts such as offices or emergency services.
definitions.explanation_cn: 泛指任何用于等待、准备或临时安置的区域或群体，尤其用于非体育语境，如办公室、急诊室等。
definitions.example_en: The candidates waited in the bullpen before their interviews, nervously reviewing their notes.
definitions.example_cn: 候选人面试前在待命区等候，紧张地翻阅着笔记。

comparison.analysis: “Bench”（替补席）泛指所有未上场的队员所坐的区域，适用于所有位置的球员，强调“休息”和“待命”；而 “bullpen” 专指棒球中投手的热身区，强调“准备上场”和“投球训练”，具有更强的专业性和功能性。
“Waiting room”（等候室）是通用术语，指人们在正式服务前等待的物理空间，如医院或办公室，强调被动等待；而 “bullpen” 虽然也有等待含义，但更强调“积极准备”和“随时投入行动”，常用于高节奏、高专业性的场景。
“Roster”（名单/阵容）是人员的列表或编制，是抽象概念；而 “bullpen” 是一个具体的物理空间，也可以引申为该空间内人员的集合体，具有空间和群体双重含义，更形象、更具体。
